definitions.definition: The person or thing in the first position.
definitions.example: He was the first to complete the course.

definitions.definition: The first gear of an engine.
Something that has never happened before; a new occurrence.
definitions.example: This is a first. For once he has nothing to say.
There was a close play at first.

definitions.definition: A first-edition copy of some publication.
A fraction of an integer ending in one.
Preceding all others of a series or kind; the ordinal of one; earliest.
definitions.example: I was the first runner to reach the finish line, and won the race.

definitions.definition: Most eminent or exalted; most excellent; chief; highest.
definitions.example: Demosthenes was the first orator of Greece.
Clean the sink first, before you even think of starting to cook.
I first witnessed a death when I was nine years old.
